author: francis.li
content:
<@592004585506340885> <@427491045308235776> <@520034910149410861> <@531934490826768418> 
1. regarding `compute_cells` function, I see that it's been added to `c-kzg-4844` repo, but I'm curious is there any efforts needed to implement it in https://github.com/crate-crypto/go-kzg-4844 or other languages library?
2. for variables like `CellsPerExtBlob`, it looks like it is only defined in ckzg lib for now, seems like we need to define them in go-kzg as well?
3. can we publish a release for c-kzg library? currently I'm using the latest commit for including new `compte_cells` code

Let me know if my understanding is incorrect, I'm trying to implement cell proof related migration feature in geth, and geth seems to be solely relying on go-kzg, while prysm currently relies on c-kzg, and go-kzg does not seem to be ready

author: jtraglia
content: Hey there, thanks for bringing this up. The other libraries have been updated too; but go-kzg-4844 has been deprecated and moved to go-eth-kzg (https://github.com/crate-crypto/go-eth-kzg). go-eth-kzg was updated here (https://github.com/crate-crypto/go-eth-kzg/commit/37673f594ad507e6b6faaad7934feef8472002f4) and rust-eth-kzg was updated here (https://github.com/crate-crypto/rust-eth-kzg/pull/300). And yes, I can make a new ckzg release soon. I've been waiting for a PR to add elixir bindings to be merged.
